data.title: Adoption hearing
data.text: Great people helping to make our day special amidst a lot of history!  The Lincoln display as well as the smell of history in the old courtroom provide an interesting look not at Butler County history but US History as well.  The architecture is attractive as well.

data.title: Historic Treasure
data.text: We went to the Court house to look at the historical architecture but we were surprised by the beauty inside and outside.  The history of the building with the fires was very interesting.  Very cool.

data.title: Beautiful historic building
data.text: The courthouse is a beautiful historic building that is being enhanced by the renovations.  Also it is a great setting at Christmas and for the Farmer's Market.  It has several places that are very photogenic.

data.title: Impressive Arcitecture From  Another Era
data.text: Sitting in Butler County, north of Cincinnati (Hamilton County), the Courthouse is an imposing structure.  Finished in 1889 and put on the Historic Registry in 1981, this building stood as an impressive stone structure in the heart of downtown Hamilton (Butler County).  Hamilton has seen better days but seems to be making a slow comeback.  If you are in the area and are at all interested in architecture check this place out.  Lots of detail and clearly designed to impress the citizens of the day with it's majesty.

data.title: Architecture Dream
data.text: Beautiful grand building located in the heart of my hometown . The history of this building and what went on inside are of legend . The air inside on the date my son married was hot and stale with only the closed in offices being air conditioned .

data.title: Hamilton, Ohio IceFest
data.text:
The city of Hamilton proudly displays the Butler County Court House which features farmer's markets and in the ODD years, is host to IceFest.

We have been attending IceFest for years and years. Sometimes we visit in near or below zero weather.

Fortunately, January 16-17, 2015 was relatively nice outdoors.

Hamilton IceFest Known as the "City of Sculpture," Hamilton's  winter extravaganza attracted more than 50,000 visitors. 

The main attraction of IceFest was hundreds of sparkling and glistening ice sculptures created by Olympic, international and local artists and carved from more than 200 blocks of ice (40 tons). This year's IceFest theme is "Hamilton Goes Hollywood."

We are looking forward to IceFest 2017 at the Butler County Courthouse.

data.title: Historic courthouse and farmer's market
data.text: This is the grand old courthouse built in the late 1800s in downtown Hamilton. It is surrounded by a raised yard with nice places to sit, and can be entered to see the architecture on the inside. Every Saturday morning during the summer there is a farmer's market around the perimeter where you can buy locally produced produce and other products, including honey from Don Popp's local honey farm.
